website_summaries.verdict: A handheld, battery-powered electronic zapper that offers a more hands-on approach to eliminating flying pests.
pros: This affordable unit is powered by only 2 AA batteries
It doesn't need to be swung, you can zap bugs simply by holding it up, pressing the button, and letting them fly into it
The Executioner comes with a one-year limited warranty
cons: While this device is effective, with larger insects, it may only stun them, so it could take a couple of zaps to get the job done

website_summaries.verdict: This affordable bug zapper racket only requires 2 AA batteries to generate a level of electricity to zap most bugs, but larger insects may survive the process. Only uses horizontal wires, not a complete grid.
pros: Loud, satisfying pop and spark on contact
cons: Pest deaths are not always instantaneous, several passes required

customer_reviews.title: Absurd.
customer_reviews.text: You have to touch the insect for the electric arc to be triggered. If you think you'll be swinging this through the air like a tennis racket, all you will accomplish is giving yourself tennis elbow. If you do manage to nail a fly with this, despite the incredibly loud pop, the fly will likely still be alive. When you press the "on" button, it emits a high-pitched whine which terrifies dogs. Even worse, the pop makes them run for cover. Battery compartment door is absurdly large and falls off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: All flash and is trash.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this, I use it to kill house flys. I read some good reviews,, I received it today. Placed new AA batteries in it and zapped my first fly. WOW what a loud crack, sparks all the flash and trash. Well the fly fell to the ground and looks dead, 10 seconds later it comes to, walks then flys away. Then I hit the second fly, same thing, third, forth, etc,,, same thing.. they all are stunned and wake up and fly away. Unless you seriously whack the fly with the racket it will not die. Well isn’t that a fly squatter? Really dissatisfied. I wouldn’t recommend this to any one.
customer_reviews.author: J Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good zap, but it eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: First things first, the zap is awesome! However, I don't think the switch works very well. It seems like it's always on, but on a low power draw until you push the button and it goes full power (I tried zapping flies with and without pushing the button). It only zaps them when I push the button, but the light stays on all the time (and I can hear a slight whining noise). I have to leave one of the batteries disconnected and push it back in when I'm ready to use it (or else it goes through a fresh set of batteries in a day or two).
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Now I enjoy an occasional fly in the house.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. When you hit a bug with this there is a bright flash and snap as it gets zapped. Dispatching insects has never been so satisfying. I haven't tried touching the screen with my finger...and I don't plan to. The flash is bright, but not as big as it looks in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems to pack a higher-voltage punch than other products
customer_reviews.text: It seems to produce higher voltage (without actually measuring) than theor the. When I press the button I hear a high pitch whine (unlike with the others) and contact with a fly makes a brighter spark with a louder SNAP! sound. With all three products a single hit isn't enough to kill houseflies—I still have to finish them off after they drop to the ground—but because this one seems to hit the flies harder on the first try I'm hoping it's more humane than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my "zapper ". Unfortunately, it must be the one that everyone else has sent back because it didn't work and they don't want to chuck it in the trash. Should have known something was up when the package was "resealed" with scotch tape. Buyer beware! I hate it when you get a product that was obviously returned because it didn't work and the company just ships it to the next victim.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: You don't have to touch it for it to come on
customer_reviews.text: Not only batteries as listed you don't even have to touch it for it to come on you can set it on the table and it comes on and it has a loud high pitch squeal this thing is very dangerous. I can blow on it and not touch the button and the red light comes on. This thing is highly defective in the seller is a liar you will not get batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useless
customer_reviews.text: Pretty uselsss, you can only swat flies in the air (as swatting them when they land would cause this thing to shatter into a million pieces). It doesnt actually kill flies. It should be called the “annoyer” not the “executioner”. I have only managed to knock one down so far and it was nearly back in the air before I could place the “executioner above it and let it fly itself into the thing a dozen times until it eventually died. This is perfect for little boys that like to burn ants with magnifying glasses. It’s sure to provide slow, tortuous deaths at the hands of sadistic people with lots of time on their hands...
customer_reviews.author: Not Assigned

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: It works as well as any of the higher priced units should. Will it kill wasps or large flies instantly? No. It will knock down or kill medium size flies and similar insects. Works great for mosquitos and fruit flies. The head is smaller than some, however, that may aid in the unit concentrating the knockdown power it has. It is just plastic so don't drop it too often or get mad and throw it if you can't hit the insect with it, IT WILL PROBABLY BREAK. Should you buy it? Yes, I think it will be a good unit to use. Just remember it has limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: It really works on Wasps & flies
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is awesome! I cannot believe how well it works. I will not go outside without it! We have a major wasp problem and literally one swat and it ZAPS really loud and wasp is down! I have also found out that if the wasp has landed you can stick this racket over top of them trapping them while pushing the button and it electrocute them so they don’t have to be flying by in order to kill them. It does make a really loud zapping sound and has a streak of “lightening” coming off when it hits something. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Angel Lucas

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay I guess
customer_reviews.text: I’m going through all my orders & giving HONEST reviews since it seems like I just can’t trust others reviews anymore. I was super happy with this bug zapper until I tried my fiancé’s bug zapper. This isn’t a bad zapper but the gaps are farther apart & I got this for fruit flies & a lot of them just go thru the gaps. This does work great on larger bugs. I also feel like the batteries die fast, and his can be recharged. So basically if you need this for tiny bugs like fruit flies then buy Zap It! The Zap It is rechargeable & definitely gets every fruit fly!
customer_reviews.author: hope delgado

customer_reviews.title: Use your power wisely
customer_reviews.text: I used this primarily to take out wasps. It will NOT kill them on first strike. It will, however, knock them to the ground leaving them semi-stunned trying to get their bearings at which time you can zap them a few more times or step on them. Also stuns june bugs and large spiders. Vaporizes gnats and mosquitoes. I would have given it one more mark if it took out wasps.
customer_reviews.author: EricInTX

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good and is a lot of fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this to deal with some wasps flying around our front porch. It's quite a bit harder to zap them with this than I though because they're constantly flying around. I zapped about 12 wasps on the first day. Maybe half of them were killed instantly and the other half either flew off or flopped around on the ground for a few seconds before I whacked them with my flip flop. I definitely recommend having a whacker with you when trying to zap larger insects because this likely won't kill most of them but it at least stuns them long enough for you to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hart

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective on bugs
customer_reviews.text: Its a little small, and it doesn't work very well on flying bugs. On crawling bugs it will irritate them and make a loud popping noise, but the bug will continue to crawl even after 4 or 5 shocks. More of an entertaining toy rather an effective bug eliminator. Not worth the money or hope that it will keep bugs away or eliminate them. A flyswatter is much more effective.
customer_reviews.author: mwhite

customer_reviews.title: Great Zapper but lousy battery compartment.
customer_reviews.text: This bug zapper does a really good job at killing bugs. I would give it 5 STARS for that. Unfortunately, the battery cover is made from cheap, thin plastic and doesn’t hold the batteries in very well. I had to wrap a piece of electrical tape around the handle where the batteries are to keep them from popping out. Be careful when using this product as it has no shield between the electrically charged wires. I forgot this and tried to swat a mosquito on my head and received a painful shock to my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S4TX

customer_reviews.title: SUCH A GOOD SWATTER
customer_reviews.text: I've had issues with flies in the house and this has been the best swatter I've purchased -- I also have one that's much more cheaply made with crappy plastic and an X-shaped surface that traps the flies in. This one does NONE OF THAT. It's got great build quality and the flies fall right through because it doesn't do some stupid criss-cross style layout. The one thing that I'm not a big fan about this one is the sound it makes when it's on -- it seems like the flies are able to hear the sound and avoid the thing a little better, but it's much better than having to deal with cleaning the cheap knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The best swatter for stinging wasps
customer_reviews.text: I have used similar products to get rid of wasps and this one is the best .The first time it comes in contact with the wasp which are invading my fountain causing the hummingbirds to fly away ,it would just stun them . I just recharge by pressing the on button a few more times and it kills them .i have tried so many things to get rid of my wasp invasion,and this works best. I wish it was wider for better coverage. Maybe they can design a bigger racket to be more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Yes, this has a bug spark
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this has a bug spark. But the two times I went after a big fly or flying bug, after I hit them and saw the spark, I lost sight or where the bug went. While looking around on the ground (floor) for them I saw them flying again. I hit one again and found out it was some king of small flying beetle. I saw it crawling on the floor after the second hit and used the vacuum to pick it up (still crawling) Might have been because of the shell but at least it knocked it out of the air
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a "magic eraser" for flies. We get small swarms of them on the back porch. A couple swooshes back and forth with the racket and they magically disappear. When we first got it, sometimes the flies would explode with a loud POP, but not so much anymore. Tried replacing the batteries, and it still works the same, just no pops. Not sure if the flies just don't have enough juice in them, or maybe the netting wires are starting to get corroded from being outside (covered)...
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It’s fun but not really as efficient as those freestanding units that attract its prey. Don’t ever set it off against your body because it packs a wallop! My wife gets a thrill from zapping flies with it and hearing it crackle when she gets her prey. My daughter had fun with it too and wanted to take one home with her back to Utah where mosquitoes abound. Unfortunately, these have suddenly become hard to find. Too bad because they are way better than the other cheapies.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Harrington, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: much smaller than 1st time we bought it
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd "executioner" unfortunately i left the 1st one outside and it got rusted so i went to buy a new one - didn't realize they completely downsized, this raquet face is about 1/2 the size of the original which is super annoying, makes it more difficult to use and the thick edges make it difficult to actually catch any bugs. bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, expect it to be useful for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool to contain and control an outbreak of pests, especially tiny flying versions. Strong and quick, effective, batteries last long but best if they are changed periodically. Especially good for those that are bothered by the humane killing of insects, Unlike pesticides which leaves pests fighting for life until they're finally dead, this will do the job quickly, mercifully. Use it as noted in other reviews with a slower wave of the wand, not a fast slashing or bashing forehand or backhand tennis stroke. As noted in other reviews, the battery compartment door does not stay closed on occasions, especially aggressive movement, but a bit of tape solves the issue. KWL
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Landry

customer_reviews.title: Mine is a KILLER
customer_reviews.text: We didn't have many flies in our last home in Okinawa, so I only used it a couple of times. And then, I forgot all about it ... Then, we moved to Alabama. Attack of the flies! I pulled out the Executioner and went to work. I walked around the house and yelled with glee every time I roasted one of those pesky flies. There's a certain jolt of adrenaline (and happiness) to my system every time I hear that CRACK-CRACK-CRACK and watch as that sucker lights up like a firecracker as this Executioner sends the fly or hornet into the next world. It's a beautiful thing ...
customer_reviews.author: Mark, the Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful this product would be the solution to my pesky bee problem. Unfortunately it does not live up to its standards. I hit bees, mosquitoes, bugs of different sizes. I hear a zap and the bugs keep flying around like it’s no big deal! I found that it only works if you zap bugs anywhere between 2 and 5 times. (I had to knock them onto the ground to determine this). I’ve had it for a month and a day and the “electric” portion of this no longer works at all. Do not recommend, big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: This is an overpriced poor performance electric fly swatter. I have attempted to kill dozens of flies with this and never a first contact kill. I can hit the flies which either temporarily stuns them or has no effect at all. I think the problem lies with the single layer of metal contact rods. The other swatters have multiple screens which traps the flies and let's you bbq them while their stuck between the screens.
customer_reviews.author: SF Giants fan

customer_reviews.title: You Must Be Smarter Than The Fly
customer_reviews.text: We've attempted to use The Executioner on multiple occasions and have yet to successfully zap anything except the neighbor guy who volunteered to be swatted to see if the thing worked. Yes, it does work. However, the flies in my part of the country are exceptionally smart. Smarter than me. Smarter than my husband. Way smarter than the neighbor guy. I'm giving The Executioner three stars because it has brought us several hours of amusement. Full Disclosure: No flies were harmed in the testing of this product. They were treated humanly and enjoyed a lovely charcuterie board. Sadly, there was one accidental drowning in a nice glass of sauvignon blanc. Memorials can be sent to charity of your choice.
customer_reviews.author: All His 247

customer_reviews.title: Not bad....but
customer_reviews.text: This won't drop a wasp, but works on smaller insects....batteries didn't seem to want to stay in the battery compartment area and light (that I supposes shows it's on) does not work. It works well, but lasted less than a year with minimal use. UPDATE: Got it out the other day and a piece of plastic that holds the batteries in their spot had broken...tried to repair it, but could not. Very disappointed. I kept it hung up in a safe place to keep it from being damaged....I guess I should have sent it back when I originally noticed the battery compartment messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Curt M.

customer_reviews.title: Can bug killing be fun?!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and boys love to use this! They often go on bug hunts just to hear the sound:-o I personally am a catch and release kinda girl, but it is hard to safely catch those pesky pantry moths so this gets the job done. I personally do not recommend using this on spiders as it sounded like it kept sparking his poor individual feet... but all the boys in the house thought it was very cool. Very safe, and easy to use - one swoop gets the moths with one zap... spiders one swoop with a few zaps.... looking forward to summer and mosquito season as that's my killing time:))
customer_reviews.author: Family3D1G

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised, but don't throw away the fly swatter.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction and sufficient electrical potential to do the job. However, considering its size it works better outdoors where there is less of a chance of striking an obstruction and annoying insects are more likely to be flying around. Indoors use is limited especially where the insect has landed on a flat surface. In this situation insect spray or the trusty fly swatter are the best defense.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Audible whine warning precedes satisfying fly-frying Zap.
customer_reviews.text: Emits a high-pitched whine when pressing the Activate button. This is an audible warning to the fly as they seem to hear the warning sound and will take off from a resting position -when I try to sneak up on -when approached by an Executioner. So the hunted fly gets an advantage That said, my 8-year-old g-daughter loves fly-hunting with this tennis-racket-size fly-frier. And the executed fly lets out a satisfying ‘Zap’ when In contact with the electrocuting current. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fiveft2eyzblue

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept, had a zapper from another manufacturer. Used it for years, no problem.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I just got a bad unit. Worked fine for about a week, then using it I got that "electrical fire" smell. It was coming from this Zapper. I could see smoke coming from it and it was starting to melt the plastic (on the right hand side if you use is right handed and have the button on your left thumb). I pulled the batteries out and set it aside. BE AWARE.
customer_reviews.author: C. Courtland

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as pictures shown
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as it looks in first picture. Not as flexible as it looks in the other product picture. You have to use two AA batteries. For the same amount of money you can buy another fly swatter that has a bigger catch area and is rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: I love this zapper, although when the bugs light up like a bomb explosion, it always scares the crap out of me! I had a rather large, well fed fly buzzing around my house for 2 days. I finally caught up with him with the zapper, and ZAP!! That was the end of Mr. Fly! It kills gnats as well. Unfortunately, it kills moths too, as my hubby zapped the poor lil bugger instead of letting him out of the house. My husband runs around like a kid in a candy store, trying to kill everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A Long

customer_reviews.title: Works sooo well!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!!!!! Have issues with screen door being left open in summer. Flies come in and won't leave. This is a game changer. It's sick but soooo satisfying to zap them. So much more effective than standard fly swatter. Sturdy too - knock on wood - it's been dropped several times on hardwood floor but after putting batteries back in, just keeps going. Would buy another in a heartbeat. Wish I'd gotten it 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MKA

customer_reviews.title: Better than the cheap one
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better electric swatter than others on the market that all seem to be made exactly alike. It doesn't have the metal guard the others have meaning its easier to get larger bugs. The activation button is also a single button (which is much better made) making it easier to use than the other ones on the market. Wires that make up the racket are much thicker and better quality. Worth the few extra dollars for one that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Babb

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for our old Executioner which had a long, busy life in our wet, mild climate with pets and chickens. We liked it so much, we went with the same brand. Durable and efficient. There is a rather loud zap that scares the dog, but it is a zapper, that is the nature of the product. We let the dogs out into the back yard or into the back room when we use it, so they aren’t bothered. It kills them on contact, humanely and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M

customer_reviews.title: It works, but effect varies.
customer_reviews.text: Goes through the batteries quickly. Most effective on new batteries. It really needs more power, but then that might be dangerous. Fifty percent kill rate. A lot of stuns. It depends on how the fly completes the circuit. A couple were actually trisected. Mosquitos, if large enough, are toasted. An instrument of justice.
customer_reviews.author: Smasher

customer_reviews.title: Everyone deserves one of these....
customer_reviews.text: No more wondering where the darn bloodsucker flew off to and going to bed scared you're going to get sucked dry. Turn this darn thing on and start swinging. I celebrate every time the zap goes off. I first used this on a gnat. The gnat turned to dust.
customer_reviews.author: EeyoreEeyoreOh

customer_reviews.title: No batteries, Awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: This product did not arrive as advertised. It was missing batteries, additionally the product that I looked at online indicated there was an on off switch. The one I received has a button which must be continuously depressed in order to keep it activated for use. Having to hold in the button makes it very awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: A light touch zaps them into oblivion.
customer_reviews.text: The exposed grill is very effective in zapping bugs. Of course you have to be careful when using it to avoid zapping yourself or others. The red light plus faint whistling sound tells you it’s activated and ready to go. No more smashed bugs against the window. It satisfies the primal instinct to kill with high tech precision. It kills smaller bugs like mosquitoes but stuns larger bugs like hornets, rendering them easier to kill.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything that flys
customer_reviews.text: I own several different bug zappers, but I have to admit the Executioner is awesome and best of class. When you hit a mosquito, miller moth, fly, or any bug you know it - pow! Has a very very slight detectible "ring" when it is charged. I don't even feel guilty of being responsible for the genecide of thousands of Northern Cascade mosquitos while camping. We never go camping without a couple of these in our arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: holisticguy

customer_reviews.title: Kills mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hunting mosquitos in our Florida yard! Zaps them with a satisfying "pop". I went back and bought a second one because it works much better than other brands we have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Don't Swing EM!
customer_reviews.text: You got to get out of the habit of swinging them at the flying bugs. It is a lot of fun when you do get one to pop. Honestly it is easier to just get an old fashioned fly swatter and slap em down. It took 4 zaps to kill a large fly. I have killed tons of spiders, mosquitos, and other bugs, but some are a pain. Haven't tried wasps yet.
customer_reviews.author: Art Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Very effective bug zapper
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it except for one thing that might just be a problem with the one I got. The cover for the batteries constantly fell off and then the batteries would fall out. I taped the handle with electrical tape which solved that problem, but obviously you shouldn't have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT C LOWE

customer_reviews.title: Battery connectionunreliable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Oct 2016. Didn't use it until the following Summer 2017. ( bought one previously and thought I'd give this one as a gift..) Put in fresh batteries. Worked fine for about a month then noticed a fly would land but not be zapped. (There is a high pitched hum when button is pushed which indicates it's "on" and it could only be heard sometimes. ) I guess I got a bad one! Test it out and make sure you hear the hum every time--if not send it back! Because of this bad experience I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Scout

customer_reviews.title: Great racket! I hate wasps
customer_reviews.text: Do you hate wasps, but love bees? Then this is for you! The really big ones it "stuns" or kills, so you can squish 'em and throw 'em out. Wasps are the worst.
customer_reviews.author: rayinchicago

customer_reviews.title: Great for killing all bugs 🕷 but giant wasp
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this just for killing giant wasp, now it kills everything easy but the giant wasp that were in my yard. It makes a little very low pitch sound so you know it’s on when using it, kills flies, mosquitoes, ladybugs, spiders, and anything else with wings on contact. Even though it didn’t work on my giant wasp, I loved it for the damage it did to every other insect.
customer_reviews.author: Philly

customer_reviews.title: No good... multiple reasons
customer_reviews.text: 1) . You cant slap the thing down on the table or the counter cause it will break... so the fly's just take off. Basically you have to hit them out of the air. 2) . It doesnt actually KILL them, it stuns them. Then you have to get a napkin or something to kill them. I will say that those annoying flys that hang in the air in the same spot doing figure 8's, its fun to try to hit them out of mid air, but no clue where they go when/if you zap them! Overall, old school fly swatter cant be beat. This is a gimmick, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ken May

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This zapper is awesome! I have a real problem with yellow jackets and when they get too nosey....zap! I never like killing anything, even a fly, but I am at war with these pests....So now when I sit on my porch and have my Executioner with me it definitely stacks the odds in my favor....Zap! Zap! Zap!......love the sound knowing there is one less possible sting coming my way....
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly, It Works....But
customer_reviews.text: This works Really well. It'll zap a fly into submission. The problem is, you can't just swat one out of the air. You have to cover the fly with the zapper and wait for the fly to "Fly," into it. It's a little frustrating, BUT, it does work. I'd like to find one that will kill a fly, bee, or other flying critters, but merely making contact with it. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pasio

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Loves This
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of flies and mosquitos and I honestly was so tired of trying to track down bugs with a hand-held vacuum or spray bottle. I don't use flyswatters as I think they're gross, but my husband has been begging for one of these after seeing my neighbor with one so I bought this one. I have to say, killing flies and mosquitos is so much easier but the pops can be a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie House

customer_reviews.title: Greatest bug killer on the market
customer_reviews.text: I saw another review on a cheaper version that I was going to buy. Glad I didn't buy that one. A personal friend of mine had bought that cheaper version and regrets it. I saw a review on the cheaper one that was talking about how great the executioner is...so I bought it. I LOVE it and my friend...she ordered the executioner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: This is Savage!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is savage and worth every penny! My son and I fried our first victim who was unfortunate to be flying around our house. He was a big monsterish bug! I actually don’t even think I hit him. I just got close enough for the zap to stun him and he went down. We finished him off after that by touching the executioner to him. Bam!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Ruppel

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for mosquitoes, which seem attracted to my bathroom. I used this to kill half a dozen in the first couple weeks. Much better than trying to chase them down and get them with my hands. When it comes in contact with the bug, it gives a satisfying CRACK sound and a small blue flash. I dropped the zapped mosquitoes in the tub at first to check whether they were really dead. Only one out of five or six came back to life. That's an acceptable kill rate, for me. Very happy with my Executioner.
customer_reviews.author: M. Croy

customer_reviews.title: Serious jolt of electricity
customer_reviews.text: Very effective at killing flies. First time using it, I saw the jolt of electricity and heard the zap, and in fact almost dropped the racket because it surprised me so much. Needless to say, one zap and the fly is dead with no mess. Just don't let your young children have access- this thing has some serious electricity with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Huggins

customer_reviews.title: We initially bought this one for the good reviews, but found that the charge is very ...
customer_reviews.text: We initially bought this one for the good reviews, but found that the charge is very powerful and many flies and hornets actually bounce off of the thing and fly away. Also we've seen flies walking around after being zapped, not able to fly. The concerning part is also that my husband felt a charge AFTER it had been used, making it totally unsafe so we sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Forest dweller

customer_reviews.title: It's got a kick.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second racket style bug zapper I have owned The first one had the 2 outer layers of non-charged wire to protect the charged wire in the center. It worked but not even near as good as the Executioner with 1 layer of charged wire(super charged wire). CAUTION--The device will have a slight risk of shock after releasing the power button. After a few seconds the risk should be gone.
customer_reviews.author: DJJeremyD

customer_reviews.title: Going on Seven Years and still Zapping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost seven years ago. I just used it once again to triumph over a big nasty fly and thought I should post a review. It’s great. You should buy it. It’s well made and very effective. Most of the time I don’t even swat flies with it, I just slowly move it up to them and zap them. But that last fly? That filthy trespasser who scared my poor little daughter half to death? Him I took on the wing as he screamed full throttle across my bathroom sky. Dead the minute he hit the wires and completed the circuit. Put a price on that feeling.
customer_reviews.author: J F

customer_reviews.title: Works and worth the price easily
customer_reviews.text: This in all reality isn't that practical. I noticed it works more effectively if you have the button pressed for a couple of seconds. It seems to need a brief moment to charge (if u put your ear near it you can hear it) but it is rather satisfying to see mosquitos get zapped.. It's even more satisfying to get people to touch it or zap people with it lol. I gave it for stars because it has a hard time zapping the small mosquitoes. But overall it was totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution to the traditional fly swatter
customer_reviews.text: This has made getting the bugs out of my house so much easier. You do have to be careful though as this one has no grill to protect you from getting a slight shock, but at the same time the lack of grill makes it more effective at taking care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: The name is quite apt and I feel like a mosquito-slaying god when wielding it
customer_reviews.text: This thing kills all the mosquitoes in the house. I have a couple located in various corners of the house so they're always on hand to EXECUTE a mosquito. The name is quite apt and I feel like a mosquito-slaying god when wielding it. Like Thor and Mjolnir, or King Arthur and Excalibur, this product is my weapon of choice against the armies of blood suckers. This is not a toy. It has no safety net things that similar products have. It is crafted for a singular purpose: to execute flies and mosquitoes. Don't live anywhere that wasps/hornets or anything large is a threat. Would probably need fire against those guys instead of lightning.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L

customer_reviews.title: The unit I received appears to have been used previously
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received appears to have been used previously. There's a lot of black discoloration on the zinc steel grills. The discoloration cannot be wiped off. It appears to be some sort of corrosion or residue from dead bugs. This unit is either used or old. See attached photo.
customer_reviews.author: Art V

customer_reviews.title: Bad @ss bug zapper.  Best I could find.
customer_reviews.text: Thing is great. I was looking for a more high voltage, commercial, or just badass zapper. This was the best I could find. Nice loud pop. Soon as I got it, I went outside to challenge the carpenter bees buzzing above my garage. POP. Down he went. Gave him a stomp with my shoe. F~ck off carp bees. I will triumph this summer. My fiancé and I love hunting wasps and carpenter bees together!
customer_reviews.author: T. Welcome

customer_reviews.title: Nice snap but low kill rate for flies.
customer_reviews.text: It produces that satisfying “snap” that we all crave but, surprisingly, the kill rate for flies is pretty bad. They often falter a bit then proceed on their merry way. Relatively effective for yellow jackets.
customer_reviews.author: CBD

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fly cereal killer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Took me a few minutes to get my technique down. Now I move in slow till I'm right over them and pop! Sounds like a cap gun goes off. It doesn't always kill them in one pop but the second round usually does and is somehow more satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Kills bugs
customer_reviews.text: Much easier interface than a prior purchase of a similar product. Single push button, no switches or other moving parts. Also, I prefer this 2 AA battery power over a USB rechargeable device. Con is that it seems a bit top-heavy, which can make for a little bit awkward handling, but overall, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Idiotpathic

customer_reviews.title: Luv this Zapper!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works on Gnats too!!! You literally see the zap and hear it sounds scary at first but it’s great for those Pesky bugs. It’s not that heavy pretty light and does not come with AA batteries so have them ready. I’m Definitely Ready for those Murder Hornets lol
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Love

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control, received product without battery cover. Submitted a message to the company and never heard back. Only option is to return on amazon, but it works I just want the battery cover. Wish i had more easier options to resolve issue.
customer_reviews.author: Walter J. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: High power and made stronger.
customer_reviews.text: We used this and the cheaper yellow ones this summer. The similar yellow ones are lighter but not as strong. This one is much better made as all the yellow ones cracked at the handle. This one is louder as it defiantly has more power. I will not buy the yellow ones again. We used it all summer on the same set of batteries!
customer_reviews.author: DJ Logger Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Executes flies, stuns everything else
customer_reviews.text: This product works great on flies and kills them on contact but my real issue was wasps and yellow jackets. The first contact only stuns them and you have to hit them multiple times to actually kill them. It’s easy to use and the racket is big enough that you don’t have to be a super accurate hitter to get your target.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Knocks out everything except a carpenter bee
customer_reviews.text: Wasps go down but don't die, kills flys and everything else smaller. Carpenter bees, they don't even fall to the ground lol.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: After going through two cheaper models - one lasted a month and the other DOA, I broke down and got this one. It works great. I like the single-layer electrode better also. Just don't touch it with your finger or to your knee ...like me. Ouch! It makes a VERY satisfying CRACK when it gets one of those cursed mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Will bring out your killer nature!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for the past 3 years or so - a kid finally destroyed it by using it like a traditional flyswatter :-(. I liked it so much I bought another one! It works great against houseflies, wasps, & mosquitos, and brings out the inner hunter-killer in even the most gentle people. The easiest way to guarantee a zap is to wait for the fly to land on a counter or window, then swipe the Executioner across the surface. The fly will see it coming and begin to take off, so you will catch it in mid-flight. ZAP!! Very satisfying. Goes easy on the batteries - one change a season should do it.
customer_reviews.author: Dadzilla

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t kill wasps.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Doesn’t kill wasps. Wish amazon would stop promoting sub standard products.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Oberheide

customer_reviews.title: It does the job amazingly well
customer_reviews.text: The ****B E S T**** product that their is out there. I was having a fly issue. Picked up a few different products. Put them all out there for a test. Put a clamp on it so it stays on. Heard it zapping every few minutes. Its the best product ever. This is a real review John Pallotta
customer_reviews.author: Chuk Bass

customer_reviews.title: Great on mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take revenge against the mosquitoes that seem to congregate against a fence corner near our house. Every time I open the screen door of our patio near this corner a bunch of them take off. Now I bring this with me and annihilate as many as I can. It's actually quite fun, especially to watch them light up and then explode with a nice pop. I've also used it to kill flies as well as get some wasps flying around my house. As others have mentioned, it takes a little longer to kill the bigger insects but it works great on small ones, which is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: Wicked little zap
customer_reviews.text: The trigger is in a good position for both finger or thumb activation. There is a slightly audible whine when the button is depressed, it freaks my dogs out, but it is not that noticeable. Very sturdy construction compared to other models/types of electric swatting devices. I like that the bugs don’t get stuck in between the wires, it makes for easy cleaning. There is a wicked little zap for sure, very powerful. I’ll be buying more for around the happier and at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L.Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting. It got to the point where setting out ...
customer_reviews.text: Our previous apartment had a cracked window screen as well as a gap between the floor and the door frame. As a result, we had a lot of flies and fruit flies. Disgusting. It got to the point where setting out apple vinegar traps weren't enough! I decided to give this a try. It worked pretty well for a month or two. Now it's barely working. I've changed the batteries twice, and you can hear this very faint buzzing noise. It doesn't kill flies anymore. Very disappointed. It worked so well and showed so much promise! Wondering if I received a defective product?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was working great and noticed it only stuns the Gnats, it does not kill them. You have to hit them over and over, they fall on the ground and you have to step on them. If it touches you it hurts, not sure why it does not kill them.
customer_reviews.author: mack

customer_reviews.title: Best yet at actually killing insects
customer_reviews.text: This actually kills bugs as opposed to just knocking them down. Had several other models that would not kill insects unless they stuck to device and you kept pushing device button. This one does an excellent job
customer_reviews.author: RMH

customer_reviews.title: Not a fly swatter
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine 5 years ago. Still zapping bugs with the original cheap "Super-Volt" battery. This cannot be used interchangeably as a fly swatter. You will break things if you do. You can trap flies against windows or flat surfaces, but don't try smacking them unless they're airborne. Obviously, this product is intended for flies, but larger insects (moths, bees, June bugs) give off a satisfying zap and sizzle.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJimTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Put batteries in it, didn’t work. Switched them out, just in case, still didn’t work. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Dobbie

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this racket so far. It works fine with a set of rechargeable AA nickel metal hydride batteries. Takes out insects as large as palmetto bugs. When you absolutely, positively got to kill every last *censored* mosquito in the room, accept no substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Q T

customer_reviews.title: Bang, Biff and ZAP...!!!
customer_reviews.text: ...spectacular hearing that ZAP as flying insects are taken down...big carpenter bees and massive cockroaches will be superbly electrocuted with this brilliant killing machine...those two insects are resistant to death...just plain tough to kill..."The Executioner", with a comfortable grip and well designed electrical killing field, makes death a marvel...Living in Hawaii, we have a wide array of target insects...we have used a few other electronic insect swatters, however, nothing performs a clean electronic death like "The Executioner"...A dangerously large wasp was just moving into a newly constructed mud home yesterday and with one swipe "The Executioner" dropped him dead...not even a leg kick or twitch..."The Executioner" will put a smile on you and a grimace on insects...!
customer_reviews.author: Outside the Pit

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Miller Moths
customer_reviews.text: Our previous swatter had mesh grid screens on the outside, limiting bigger bug effectiveness. The Executioner doesn't have any screens, just the exposed electrodes allowing bugs of whatever size to get zapped.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: ZAP
customer_reviews.text: I saw some reviews about these not working... I say the loud ZAP and the very bright flash says otherwise. Course the fly has to be big enough, if you swing it at a fruit fly you probably won't get anything. I do agree with the other review, it's cheap plastic. Don't drop it, don't hit it against something. It's made to kill flies, not your floor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Flikkema

customer_reviews.title: Bugs beware!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! I brought it down on a trip to the Caribbean. This product works and then some. It either kills or stuns any insect it comes in contact with. Bugs don't stand a chance. There is even a satisfying "pop" sound when you get a bug on the business end, I have to admit it is more than slightly addictive. Buy this if you think you will be traveling to a place with lots of flying bugs. The only minor complaint is that eventually, the battery cover became loose with use and would release along with both AA batteries. A little tape solves this however. This thing is no JOKE!
customer_reviews.author: happygolucky

customer_reviews.title: A must have! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and works great. It’s a decent size so able to hit almost anything. The handle is fantastic and comfortable and the button is very shy to access. This is by far a must have if you want to deal with bugs, flys, etc... and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Vogelbacker

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great.
customer_reviews.text: This Zapper is the Boss. It is powerful. It's good on most all pest,flying or crawling. I now have two of these. It's worth the extra bucks to get what you really want. The power is off as soon as you release the button.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B English

customer_reviews.title: ... my other fly swatter but it does make a nice loud pop when the brains of the fly explodes ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as my other fly swatter but it does make a nice loud pop when the brains of the fly explodes out of it's butt. This unit you can touch and get a minor discomfort but my other unit was downright painful. Also it may take popping the fly a couple of times before it kills it. My other unit would take care of the fly in one contact. In my opinion, their advertisement that this is the most powerful fly swatter on the market is just hype. Most powerful sounding one maybe but not the most power through the wiring. Very entertaining "POP" makes this a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Seaside

customer_reviews.title: Simply wonderful and consistent "snap"!!
customer_reviews.text: I normally shy away from anything "as seen on TV" (i.e., usually junk). However this thing is simply awesome. The "snap" you get from hitting a bug can be heard from across the room, and I suspect anyone who has had a pesky fly annoy you for any length of time will take great satisfaction with the "execution." I got a paper wasp with this as well, and that ALSO worked, unlike most but zapper/swatters I have used. I recommend this big time....
customer_reviews.author: James Downey

customer_reviews.title: ZZZZZZZZZZZZAP!  OMG - Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the racket to kill Spotted Lantern Flies (SLF). Works great. Pro Tip: Hold the racket in front of the SLF and move it towards the SLF until ZZZZZZZAP! The racket only seems to stun flies however I still love to use it. The sound is very satisfying! Pro Tip: Let the fly land then slowly hover over the fly and lower the racket until the ZZZZZZAP!!!! Since the fly will only be stunned you have to put the racket on top of the fly for a 2nd ZZZZZAP!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to kill the red wasps that swarm around our hummingbird feeders and although it won't kill a wasp, it'll stun one enough so you can stomp it to death. That's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Shock is pathetic, but still can kill
customer_reviews.text: The bugs definitely die quicker from being smashed in the face by the metal bars in the racket. The shock makes for a cool popping sound but not much else. It's essentially cripples the bug and makes it easier for you to kill. Even a standard house fly bounced off this thing and fell in my sink. It buzzed around unable to fly until I washed him down the drain. To test it, I even held it up against a moth on my door to wait for the moth to fly into it. Same thing. Popped, saw a spark. Moth fell to the ground and then pathetically tried to fly away but couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to rid yourself of bugs
customer_reviews.text: Works great on smaller insects but the large Wood Bees seam to resist it well. My kids like the loud snapping noises but have a tough time taking out the pesky wood bees which is why I wanted it in the first place. Makes a small high pitched noise when on also. I have 2 and they both do it so I suspect that is normal.. I believe the insects can hear it as they fly away as soon as I turn it on. Need to be in mid swing before pressing the on button to avoid the pre mature scare off. All in all fun product and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Downs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic flying insect killer
customer_reviews.text: This product really works! After having several where the electronic fibers are layered in between two protective layers of plastic, which also creates a barrier to the actual insect. This is so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: probably the best out there for taking out mosquitoes in split seconds the box it was shipped in was Hugh and only one piece of packing tape it was loose when it arrived and if the box had been upside down at anytime it could have fallen out for sure. need to inspect your shipping team, that was the only issue I seen with this product
customer_reviews.author: robert field

customer_reviews.title: Favorite fly swatters
customer_reviews.text: We've owned several electric fly swatters, and this one is the best! The one we usually get have a protective mesh over the zapping part, so flies sometimes would get away or have to be zapped twice. The Executioner doesn't have the mesh and is definitely more powerful. I'll be buying this one from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Darren M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: The battery cover easily opens and allows the batteries to fall out
customer_reviews.text: I hope the eve done some updates from when I purchased this over a year ago. The battery cover easily opens and allows the batteries to fall out. Also, its so powerful that I noticed it usually doesn't kill flies on a first go. Typically, it vaporize the wings turning the flies into giant ants, essentially. It does work, but not as week as cheaper less powerful ones.
customer_reviews.author: ja

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much a guaranteed kill on first contact
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, yes....but not having the safety screen makes this much more effective and worth it. The ZAP is huge!! I've had other swatters and they do work, but this is next level. So far, I like!!
customer_reviews.author: rjk

product_meta.title: The Executioner Fly Killer Mosquito Swatter Racket Wasp Bug Zapper Indoor Outdoor Over 50cm Long
product_meta.description: Simply press the button and swing, once the Fly, Wasp or Bug touches the screen it will be instantly Zapped unlike the 3 layer rackets who often have to try several times to get a Zap because of the dead outer layers Superb Build Quality Genuine branded Executioner Not a cheap copy Ideal for Home, Office, Camping, BBQ's and any outdoor activities where Flying bugs bother you Instant Zap Single Layer 1. 2mm Zinc Steel Grill Made with ABS Plastic not brittle recycled plastic Positive on and off button with LED warning light and instant off once button released Very High Quality Electronics which have been tested to over 100, 000 Zap's Our Racket comes with 2 AA (UK only USA no batteries are supplied) Branded Alkaline Batteries Fully CE Approved and UK Trading Standards Passed, our racket is built to last. WARNING: This product is powered by Alkaline batteries As with all Alkaline batteries, these could explode or leak, if recharged, disposed of in fire, mixed with a different battery type, inserted backwards, physically damaged or disassembled, this could cause burns or injury Replace all batteries at the same time Do not carry batteries loose in your pocket or purse. Do not remove the battery label. Visually check all batteries regularly, if there is any sign of damage or if a battery becomes excessively warm during use please dispose of outside in a metal container
feature_bullets: Genuine branded Executioner * Not a Cheap Copy *
Size 20" x 7" , Built to last, Made with ABS Plastic not brittle recycled plastic
Requires 2xAA Batteries not Supplied, Retail pack may vary for USA Market
Fully CE Approved and Trading Standards Passed
Top quality, our racket is built to last!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,649 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
